Cross-kingdom OS × Bias-aware evidence engine

Predicting Cross-Kingdom Therapeutics,Before They Reach the Lab.

NeuroBotanica is the world's first predictive systems biology platform for botanical drug discovery. We don't just catalog molecules; we map their path from ancestral wisdom to FDA compliance across cannabis, marine, fungal, and plant polysaccharide domains—the operating system for cross-kingdom therapeutics.

GenomePath™ AIBridging Ancient Wisdom & Modern Genomics

The vocabulary of Traditional Knowledge and the language of modern genomics have never spoken the same dialect—until now.

  • 98.11% accuracy linking TK intents to genomic targets (e.g., TRPV1 downregulation).
  • Bias-aware and built to route 70% of commercial value to Indigenous stakeholders.
  • Hybrid AI combining Morgan ECFP4 fingerprints with multilingual text embeddings.

Validation Journey

From manuscript to deployment in four luminous steps.

Scrollytelling timeline pairs copper root systems with living data; ideal for Cloudflare Pages cinematic reveals.

Stage 01

Ingest & Normalize

Upload manuscripts, terpene panels, and TK metadata for harmonization.

11s ingestion median

Stage 02

Edge Inference

Workers multi-region lattice predicts viable dimers and terpene deltas.

235ms edge median

Stage 03

Bias-Aware Review

Human-in-the-loop review with cultural equity scoring and audit logs.

92% faster than manual

Stage 04

Pilot & Deploy

Stripe-backed retainers, budtender tablet rollout, and compliance packet.

4-week MVP pilots

Budtender Suite

Tablet-first cannabis intelligence for Nevada dispensaries.

The Budtender Suite is a dedicated, shared-device interface for floor staff. It surfaces strain guidance, terpene explanations, and patient-friendly talking points without exposing backend controls or PHI.

In Phase 1, this section anchors pilots and training; the live tablet UI remains gated while we finalize video walkthrough assets for secure distribution.

Floor-ready workflows

Rapid strain lookup, terpene-centric guidance, and simple patient-facing narratives tailored to Nevada's regulatory context.

Knowledge Library

Evidence-Based Intelligence.

We don't just aggregate data; we validate it through peer-reviewed briefs and TK-aligned clinical evidence. Full archive access is provided on request to verified partners.

Knowledge Library

Cannabis Therapeutics (JAMA Review 2026)

Evidence gap across U.S. clinicians

Topic: Therapeutic use of cannabis and cannabinoids

Key insight: Only 33% of clinicians feel confident in cannabis knowledge while 86% are requesting structured education.

Our solution: NeuroBotanica’s tiered evidence engine (ChemPath™ + BioPath™) delivers clinician-ready packets with TK provenance.

Hsu M, et al. JAMA. 2026;335(4):345-359.

Knowledge Library

Psilocybin Analogs & Cellular Longevity

Emory University · Discover Magazine 2026

Topic: Psilocybin analogs and anti-aging outcomes

Key insight: Metabolized psilocin extended human cell lifespan by 50%+ and preserved telomeres in vitro.

Our solution: Our Compliant Analog Discovery workflow flags non-hallucinogenic variants for regulated therapeutic pipelines.

Source: Discover Magazine / Emory University research notes.

Science in the Public Trust

NeuroBotanica is an initiative of Cloak & Quill Research, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. We are dedicated to advancing evidence-based botanical science without the pressure of shareholder returns.
